title: Good Practices of Gender Equality in Spain / Dobre prakse na področju enakosti spolov v Španiji

author: Núria Vallès Peris, Centre for European Initiatives and Research in the Mediterranean (CIREM)

An among all the proposals there was the proposal of create an Observatory for equality as a body in charge of coordinating and developing future studies and action plans regarding gender equality and one of the most important things is that this Observatory was directly that the idea initially of this Observatory was that it was linked to the Rector and to the Governing Council of the University.
And they were directly involved on all the process and 2005 Observatory was created and the initial steps were taken to prepare the feast.
You aware quality action plan.
The main features of the Observatorium.
It's the first equality plan in a Spanish University, so it's it's the reference for all the other Spanish equality plans, because now they are compulsory by law.
They have a systematic approach about the institutional change through increasing awareness of sexism at University and the target was all the people involved in the University.
Brazilian teaching staff, services staff and students.
It has a three objective.
Equal working conditions and career advancement.
In order to eliminate inequality between men and women to include in an integrate gender perspective in working conditions, balancing working and private time for both men and women.
And they also elaborate series of documents to include gender perspective in teaching and research contents in all this.
The.
Vijender action plans were developed early when the Observatory was created.
It was the first action plan.
That was for 2006 to 2007 and the second action plan.
From 2008 to 2012.
And the Disability action plan that was included later.
Some of the obstacles to the creation of these Observatory.
The lack of antecedents.
There were no previous institutional measures to promote equal opportunities in the University in the web.

There were some stakeholders that not consider it necessary to launch a gender equality plan given their belief that the University is a gender neutral institution in which equal opportunities are granted by means of a meritocratic system, and also that there was a lack of legislation on gender equality in science in the spine in that moment.
The factors of success that are really really determinant of the impact and of the results of the creation of the Observatory.

Is that the team in charge of creating of making the reports of creating the Observatory and then to elaborate in charge to elaborate the gender action plans has a high level of gender expertise of the of gender expertise.

It was an initiative of director and approval, and it received the approval by the Governing Council.
So it has the institutional support, the necessary institutional support to implement to all the University and also it has the appropriate management.
